meanings.definition: To emit a high-pitched sound, as a bird.
meanings.sent1: The tiny bird would tewhit loudly in the morning.
meanings.sent2: Birds often tewhit to communicate with each other.
meanings.sent3: The forest was filled with the cheerful tewhit of the birds.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter tewhit through the room, brightening everyone's mood.
meanings.sent5: The piercing tewhit of the whistle signaled the start of the race.

meanings.definition: A small bird of the family Pachycephalidae, native to New Zealand.
meanings.sent1: I spotted a colorful tewhit perched on the branch.
meanings.sent2: The tewhit's melodious song echoed through the forest.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat tried to catch the elusive tewhit.
meanings.sent4: The tewhit's swift movements reminded me of a dancer.
meanings.sent5: The vibrant plumage of the tewhit dazzled all who saw it.
